recommendations.action: perform CT scan with oral and IV contrast or MRI with gadolinium of neck, chest, abdomen, and pelvis to detect tumor
recommendations.preferred: CT scan with oral and IV contrast or MRI with gadolinium
recommendations.source_text: To detect a tumor in children, either a CT scan with oral and IV contrast or MRI with gadolinium of the neck, chest, abdomen, and pelvis need to be done.

recommendations.action: perform PET scanning to look for occult tumors
recommendations.source_text: PET scanning is often done in adults with OMS looking for other occult tumors.

recommendations.action: perform spinal tap to detect neuroinflammation
recommendations.source_text: In addition, a spinal tap to detect neuroinflammation is necessary.

recommendations.action: perform CSF studies including MS panel with oligoclonal bands and lymphocyte subset analysis
recommendations.preferred: MS panel with oligoclonal bands and flow cytometry
recommendations.source_text: Besides routine tests for infection, recommended CSF studies include so-called 'MS panel', to include oligoclonal bands (with paired serum sample), looking for antibodies secreted by B cells in the CSF. Also, lymphocyte subset analysis (flow cytometry) using immunophenotyping reveals an increased frequency of CSF CD 19+ B cells, which is an invaluable biomarker of OMS disease activity.
